--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "dmcg123" <duncan@...> wrote:
> After ov=
er 10 years of using JUnit, it has only just struck me that test methods mu=
st return void, but why?
> I've just come across an example where a particu=
lar test did a lot of work, and I wanted to piggy-back on its final state b=
y calling the method from another test.

Been there, done that :)

Years ag=
o I asked *exactly* the same question on this list, and eventually wrote an=
 extension of JUnit that allows tests to piggy-back on the result of other =
tests. See http://scg.unibe.ch/jexample

cheers,
AA
